nodes.bodyText: These seem excessively long 🤔 didn't know this was valid
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -135,6 +133,36 @@ Note that the library automatically flushes stats on application backgrounding/t
   // Swift
   builder.addStatsFlushSeconds(5)
 
+~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
+``addAppVersion``
+~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
+
+Specify the version of the app using Envoy Mobile. This information is sent as identifying
+information when flushing metrics.
+
+**Example**::
+
+  // Kotlin
+  builder.addAppVersion("version")
+
+  // Swift
+  builder.addAppVersion("version")
+
+~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

nodes.bodyText: trimmed them. But yeah, restructuredtext actually does not require them to be the width of the text. Interestingly, they also don't require specific characters to denote specific heading levels...

nodes.bodyText: Let's use mock version strings like the docs comments above

Shouldn't this work?

  
    
  
    

  
  This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                        .replace("{{ app_version }}", String.format("%s", appVersion))
          
          
            
                        .replace("{{ app_id }}", String.format("%s", appId));
          
          
            
                        .replace("{{ app_version }}", appVersion)
          
          
            
                        .replace("{{ app_id }}", appId);

We should move forward with these changes but something that we will need to figure out when we revisit our ergononmics:
These properties leak the Android abstraction onto the EnvoyConfiguration :(
Ideally, we should have a separate configuration for Android and Java libraries
Sure, this could be moved to be a param that gets injected by the client builder. Won't fix in this PR as it was already here, is that ok?
Nope. Don't fix in this PR :)
